alert.note: Alert for Posey; Vanderburgh (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:55AM EST until January 16 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam affecting Pulaski and Ballard Counties. Ohio River at Shawneetown affecting Union, Crittenden, Hardin and Gallatin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kentucky...Missouri...Illinois... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam affecting Vanderburgh, Daviess, Warrick, Spencer and Henderson Counties. Ohio River at Cairo affecting Mississippi, Ballard, Pulaski, Hickman, Alexander, Fulton and Carlisle Counties. Ohio River at Mount Vernon affecting Union, Posey, Henderson and Vanderburgh Counties. Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam affecting Union and Posey Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall and snow melt will continue to keep water levels on the lower Ohio River in or near minor flood into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Mount Vernon. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 36.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM CST Friday was 36.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 37.1 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 100 PM CST.
